column5: We went up last saturday the 22nd and came back today. In my opinion MNdot does not have the detour marked very well at all. I used my navigation in the truck and had no problems. I'm glad I had navigation to use. Good luck to everyone else on their travels this year.
Any recent reports on the detour from Superior to route 53 in Duluth? Wife and I went north on 61 a month ago and it was poorly marked and we mostly had to figure it out ourselves. Pooch
Was there a marathon or something ?...........lol.
What is the current road conditions in superior/duluth? Which bridge are they using? We are heading up 61 once we cross the bridge. Thanks for any help.

I ran Hwy. 53 thru Superior/ Duluth on Sunday. It was not bad, in my opinion. Just be a bit patient, the detour was well marked and traffic moved at a good pace. It just takes a few extra minutes extra but in a 12 hour trip, I just use the detour as a little bit of a mind numbing relaxation!!
The Bong Bridge, or U.S. 2 is open. I drove across it both directions on Saturday, July 8th. There were no issues either direction. Jimmy Mac

The blatnik and bong bridge are both open. I'd suggest staying away from downtown superior street into Garfield , leading to the blatnik.. road construction makes it pretty tight down there. I see lots of boats down in that area, must be launching underneath the blatnik bridge. I work in Duluth delivering diesel and gas and it definitely gets busy in that area. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Would someone please post detailed directions on using the bong bridge? I assume Google maps would pick it up and be correct once I started that way, but just to be safe if anybodyâ€™s willing to put detailed directions on here I would appreciate it. We are crossing at international Falls.
I use google maps and it will have you follow the detour but you could take the Bong bridge and follow 2 to midway road, that will take you out to 53 and avoid the construction.
Try using this link....https://www.google.com/maps/place/Ri...a3oy?entry=ttu It is a Google Map of the Bong Bridge along with surrounding roads.. Jimmy Mac

I would say to cross the Bong, take left [South] on to I-35. Go up the hill take Right exit onto US-2, continue to Midway Rd. [Co.13] Stop light go Right and stay on it untill you come to US-53 in Pike Lake. Now its a Left and put the pedal down .. Good Luck and have a safe trip.

Working in Superior and living in Duluth is what started my chronic bridge anxiety I've spent hours stuck on Bong Bridge & High Bridge slicker than snot, 30 mph crosswind glad I moved.Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Drove back yesterday from our trip, in Duluth I would just stick to Blatnick/53 cause construction wasn't a big deal at all. Almost no delay. Same thing in regards to our ride up. Followed Google map advice,
